document_data.name: Splatters Doolug
document_data.mainbody:
'''Splatters Doolug''' was a mural painter from the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|It's street art. If you don't like it, you can literally walk away.|Splatters Doolug}}
document_data.Description: Doolug was a [[half-orcish]] man of a large frame with a rough orcish face, curly blonde hair, and a muddy light green hide. He often wore an artist's garb and a feathered beret.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, during the [[Absolute crisis]], Splatters Doolug spent his days painting murals on the [[Old Wall (Baldur's Gate)|Old Wall]]. His art faced criticism from some passersby Baldurians, like [[Slatey Marven]], who thought Doolug took criticism poorly.
